p: It is utilized in Chinese folk medicine. Main chemical constituent of Coptis chinensis is berberine which is responsible for its major pharmacological activities such as sedative, immunostimulatory, hypotensive, antimicrobial, choleretic, anticonvulsant, uterotonic, antihelminthic, anticancer and carminative activities. Moreover, it also affects lipid and carbohydrate metabolism, cardiotonicity and endothelial function. Because of all these activities, in the last decade, this alkaloid is a point of interest for researchers [ 76].
